page.title: 01Wooler
page.content: {Wooler}is a small market town of about 2000 people.It is surrounded by good agricultural land and the{Livestock} {Mart.}is well known over a wide area. To the west of the town are the {Cheviot}Hills,popular with tourists, walkers and hangliders.To the North is the Milfield Plain,a wide,flat valley which is frequently flooded in winter. The A697,a main route between Scotland and England,passes through the town.Roads from Berwick,Chatton, Coldstream converge from the north to meet the road from Morpeth and Alnwick to the south. The area around Wooler is rich in historical sites.The{Battle of {Homildon Hill}in 1402 is marked by the {Bendor Stone.}There are lynchets,cup and ring marks and forts on the local hills.
